Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2011 09:07PM goldiebelle wrote: You ladies are scaring me!!   I had my double mx on june 6 .  When the doc pulled my drains they where putting out over 100 a day.  I have been going back each week and he has been getting at least 100 every week.  He has not mention putting the drains back in.  I just won't go back lol.  Dreidteacher I hope this does not happen to either of us.

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2011 08:07PM goldiebelle wrote: Hi Lawgirl   Hope you are doing better.  I just finished Rads last friday and I too am in a lot of pain.  I am african american and I thought foolishly that I would not burn as much because of my darker skin.  I am burnt from my neck down.  The rads went through me and my back is also burnt.  Freaked me out when I saw that.  I am using silverdine or whatever it is called and  taking pain meds.  This too shall pass.

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2011 12:10PM goldiebelle wrote: Hi Amy I know that all of this is scary. A year ago December I was told I had breast cancer. Talk about a Christmas spoiler. Because it was near the holidays and every doctor and surgeon was on vacation it was a very long wait. I started chemo the end of January and had my surgery in June. It has been a long year but like someone else said there will be a time when minutes then hours go by without you thinking about your cancer. It will. Or be an easy road but it is doable. If you need anyone to talk to we are mere for you. Pm me anytime you want to vent or have questions that I may cease to help you with.
Posts.Title: Terrified. New here. AmyLB maryhelen

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2011 01:36AM goldiebelle wrote: My BS said he always take drains out at two weeks no matter how much output because of the risk of infection if they stay in. In the beginning he said that I would have to see him two or three times. it has been eight I think He has not mentioned putting the drain back in. I was doing my radiation during this time(finished radiation on Friday ) Maybe that had something to do with my output.

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2011 02:00PM goldiebelle wrote: Hi dlb I am not in your situation so I don't have a lot of advice for you. I do agree with thegirlinorange, let it be a need to know deal. If your boyfriend is the same age range as you are he may not be mature enough to give you the support you need. Not that that is a bad thing. Do the things you need to do to take care of yourself starting now. Talk to doctors and get some advice. We are here for you
